page.title: 07 Dane Park
page.content: Dane Park is in a large residential area of Margate. It is a recreation park, mostly used by the local people. Some children bring their footballs, bikes or skates to the park but their are swings, a slide, and two climbing frames and a large rockery on which children can climb. There are large grassed areas with flower bed, and benches to sit on. Many different kinds of trees grow in Dane Park, but about 40 trees have died, mostly from Dutch Elm disease - these have been replaced by saplings. There are also facilities for adults - you can watch Margate Cricket Club play other clubs most Sundays and bowling by the Dane Park Bowling Club, but the bowling green and two tennis courts can be hired by the general public.
